definition: to express (emotions in prose)/a written description (of emotions)
to express/to give expression to/variant of 紓|纾[shu1]/to relieve

sentences.english: I want to express a different love history.
sentences.chinese: 我想抒寫一本不一樣的愛情史。

sentences.english: Passion sparks dream, Sport opens a new chapter of communication.
sentences.chinese: 激情點燃夢想火焰，運動抒寫東師華章。

sentences.english: Zhang Kejiu takes Sanqu verse to describe landscapes and to express natural disposition and intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 小山將散曲當作詩來創作，描寫山水，抒寫性靈。

sentences.english: It gave them words to attatch to their feelings.
sentences.chinese: 詩歌提供了詞藻來抒寫他們的感情。

sentences.english: The fourth part mainly discusses the expressive art of xinqiji's rural emotion.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分主要論述辛棄疾田園隱逸情懷的抒寫藝術。

sentences.english: I would like to express a distinct love history.
sentences.chinese: 我想抒寫一本不一樣的愛情史。

sentences.english: Like many other writers, Fang Fang has expressed humble and incompetent images of fathers.
sentences.chinese: 和許多作家一樣方方抒寫了卑瑣無能的父輩形象。

sentences.english: The new historical novel is good at expressing human nature and designing tragedy plot.
sentences.chinese: 新歷史小說注重對人性的抒寫和悲劇情節的構思。
